All this atheist hate on the charity program distresses me. Some of you say that living in the streets is better than being in a much more comfortable orphanage that is also liked to the Faith. All right, then people ask why so. Your answers are all quite similar: you would not believe in a lie. I do not care whether you think God's existence is a reality; I guarantee that all of you believe in some lie.

Is introduction of a religion to orphans really that big a problem? See our school system, how many lies we are taught (and how many AP teachers and college professors need to fix them for you). Search for YouTube videos under the keyword "misnomers" or "misconceptions" and watch them all. I know some of what I believe are lies waiting to be fixed, and I know all of you, atheist or not, also have lies tethered in your minds, too. Forget the God issue because let's be honest... we always have bigger, more important debates.

As a final note, do understand that science and religion are not each other. They are like oil and water: they are too different to mix, and everything is more pleasant if they don't clash. Besides, I've seen many wonderful theist and atheist figures in science.

Good afternoon Destin my name is Luis Fernando and i am from Perú. The point is that i just wanted to say that i would like very much to help you with anything you need everytime you come to Perú, or with any cuestion you have about my country. And finally i sorry that i can t help with that charity organization in Iquitos because i still at school but im helping im my school s charity club that sends many donations and people to make things easier in Pamplona. I wish you luck and inspiration to post millions of videos and to never stop sharing science.

Now, I'm sure you know the nucleus of Not Forgotten's agenda... God. Personally, yes I am an atheist and I think it's wrong. But in the end, I'm just happy to know that they're still.. mostly going for a good cause.

I'm not exactly educated on Peruvian homeless shelters, but are there no secular organizations? I feel torn with supporting them.. on the one hand, they are getting children off the streets. Awesome! I am not religious myself, but I respect you and what you are doing with your life.

Dear Youtube commenters, please T.H.I.N.K. before you post.
T - is it true?
H - is it helpful?
I  - is it inspiring?
N - it is necessary?
K - it is kind?
I don't care if someone replies with hate, insult, and/or profanity. That's not my problem, that's theirs.
